H0.text: It becomes warmer and forms clouds as a moist air mass moves upward in the atmosphere.

H1.text: It becomes cooler and forms clouds as a moist air mass moves upward in the atmosphere.

H2.text: Its temperature remains the same as a moist air mass moves upward in the atmosphere.

H3.text: Its temperature varies greatly when a moist air mass moves upward in the atmosphere.

A4.text: With further decrease in temperature the water vapor in excess of the equilibrium amount condenses, forming cloud, and releasing heat

A5.text: Before saturation, the rising air follows the dry adiabatic lapse rate
